rules.text: Small-scale A/R activities eligible when total area < 16,000 ha and participants grouped as defined.
Definitions for grouped smallholder projects include participants, monitoring entity, and leakage belt.
Project boundary includes above- and below-ground biomass, dead wood, litter, and soil carbon pools unless excluded with justification.
Baseline scenario assumes continuation of pre-project land use with carbon stock change set to zero.
Project removals calculated by summing carbon stock changes per pool minus fossil fuel and fertilizer emissions.
Leakage from activity shifting or market effects monitored and deducted using Tool 14 default factors.
Monitoring plan requires permanent plots measured every five years plus tracking of grouped participant compliance.
Data and parameters table specifies default biomass factors and sampling requirements.
Uncertainty calculated per Tool 12; apply deductions when precision exceeds 10%.
Non-permanence risk buffer determined via Tool 15 and updated when risk profile changes.
Normative tools and references (Tools 02, 08, 12, 14, 15, 16) must be accessible to grouped project manager.
Annual net removals computed as sum of pool changes minus leakage and emissions, divided by years between measurements.
Annexes include participant enrollment records, training logs, and dispute resolution evidence.
